If you're building basically pure defense on Vi then she *is* a Tank.

A Tank is a Fighter or melee-Mage who can:
1) Initiate team fights
2) Peel for their team
3) Represent a significant threat over time, forcing them to be focused
4) Soak oodles of damage

So long as you sit on your Ult in case one of your soft buddies gets jumped, Vi fills all four criteria for a True Tank.  Her initiate isn't as strong as, say, Amumu.  But she makes up for it by being a HUGE threat over time if ignored.

This isn't WoW.  Tanks can't pull aggro.  So they have to have some *actual* reason to be a threat to the enemy team.

Some Tanks do it with CC for days (Leona or Alistar)

Some Tanks do it with significant damage over time (Amumu)

Some Tanks do it by shredding enemy defenses and making their team mates more dangerous (Sion and Rammus)

Some Tanks do it by putting out powerful auras that buff their buddies (Taric)

Some Tanks do it by just *hurting a whole hell of a lot* (Tank Jman or Tank Vi)

There's no such thing as a 'Bruiser'.   There are only Fighters who like to build more or fewer defensive items.

No, he's got a solid list there for tanks. You're misinterpreting the third point to mean a **damage** threat.

This was something LoL had to figure out a LONG time ago about tanks: this isn't an MMO, and other people don't have an aggro system. Building tanky in LoL doesn't do anything for your team if you're not the one taking damage. For you to be the one taking damage, the enemy team has to have a reason to attack you over someone else.

What that reason is varies Champion to Champion, but a tank needs some reason they are a threat, or they simply get ignored, and can't tank anything. Sometimes that threat is spammable CC. Sometimes it's being a ridiculous peel for the Marksman. Sometimes it's simply that they have easy ways of diving onto the squishies and presenting a danger to them that way. It varies a lot, but a tank needs a reason to be hit, or he can't actually tank anything.
